title: From the way Jhin talks about Shen and Zed...
body:
It sounds like both of them helped Shen's father lock him away.

Is it wrong to think that I want to see a younger Shen and Zed, working together, inseparable as brothers, promoting peace?

replies.body:
A common enemy might have the two of them fight side by side again.  For a short time at least.  The enemy of my enemy is a potential ally after all.  

I'm really interested in seeing Jhin's longer lore now.

Now I want a cinematic of Jhin laying a trap for Zed under a fullmoon night, luring Zed onto the stage Jhin has set for Zed's final act. The insuring battle is a riveting dance through the shadows as Jhin uses traps to keep the master of shadows at bay, before finally lining up for the killing shot. 

But as the bullet echoes through the night it only strikes a shimmering shield of energy as Shen appears at Zed's side, the two turning to face down the artist of death so obsessed with their end. And Jhin off course would only tilt his head, the mask hiding his expression, before taking aim again, the unannounced actor only being yet another fine and long waited stand-in in his play of death.
Very cool.
Rito, hire this man.

I'm glad to hear that Zed's issues are more complex. He's always been an anti-hero in my eyes. I've always thought that he isn't necessarily evil. He felt betrayed by his master. His issues weren't with Shen, they were with his master. For all we know, deep down, he might still view Shen as a friend. 

The main reason I love Zed is not just because he's my favorite character to play, but also because of his lore. You can call him evil if you want, but he only did what he did because he has a heart. Because he felt hurt. And too often nowadays you see heartless villains in stories. Zed is original, and I dearly hope the lore team doesn't disappoint on him. 

Here's one of my fanfictions if you have the time. http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/bz8bqYpp-zed-vs-shen-reposted-for-the-new-forum I stayed as true to the original characters as I possibly could, while adding my own personal touch to each of them. I hope you like it.
